numbered_ace_sentences: 1. More people who are 15 years old to 24 years old believe that the world is becoming a better place.
2. Less people who are 40 years old or older believe that the world is becoming a better place.
3. This means that younger generations are more optimistic than older generations.
4. I noticed that less developed countries are more optimistic than some developed countries.
5. I wonder if less developed countries are more optimistic because the quality of life in these countries is increasing.
6. I wonder if less developed countries have a different point of view than people in developed countries.
7. I wonder what the definition of the statement "the world is getting better with each generation" is.
8. This definition could be different in the opinion of different people.
9. This relates to the community around me.
10. I am in the age group 15 years old to 24 years old.
11. I can relate to people in this age group.
12. This shows me what my generation thinks of the world.
13. This also shows me what the generations of my parents think of the world.
14. The headline is: "Is the World Becoming a Better Place?"
